tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten draft letter from Schenker to Adler, dated February 7, 1927

tei:transcription.tei:p: 7. 2. 27 Hochgeehrter Herr Hofrat! Writing of the letter (the fair copy of which is not known to survive) of which this is a draft is recorded in Schenker's diary for February 7 (OJ 3/9, p. 3033): "To Prof. Adler (letter): [I] thank [him] for the invitation, but turn it down because I feel compelled to express myself in the manner [that I have] practiced hitherto concerning Beethoven, which is, however, not suited to a conference." ("An Prof. Adler (Br.): danke für die Einladung, lehne aber ab, weil ich unter dem inneren Zwange stehe, mich in der bisher geübten Weise zu Beethoven zu äußern, die aber zu einem Kongreß nicht passe."). The draft is written on the verso of a torn part-sheet in Jeanette Schenker's hand of a theoretical text.
